body: Monuments, Memorials, and Statues           The Boy Scout Memorial, located off 15th Street, NW, is one of several memorials located within President's Park. NPS  President's Park and the land surrounding the White House has a number of monuments, memorials, and statues. Because of the White House's relevance in all Americans' lives, these points of interest represent diverse people, groups, and topics that are as diverse as the American people. Lafayette Park   Andrew Jackson Statue Baron Von Steuben Statue Marquis de Lafayette Statue Marshal Rochambeau Statue Thaddeus Kosciuszko Statue    Ellipse  Boy Scout Memorial Bulfinch Gatehouse Butt-Millet Memorial Fountain First Division Monument Haupt Fountains National Christmas Tree Original Patentees Memorial Second Division Memorial William Tecumseh Sherman Statue Zero Milestone    Â   Error: You have supplied an invalid NPMap ID. title: President's Park (White House): Monuments, Memorials, and Statues
